description: Talk about a KILLER a happy hour 5-7 m-s. They were very nice. Cool hole in the wall vibe. Gyoza, veg tempura, nigiri, and their house rolls were delicious. I will 100% be coming back!
author: Juliana D.

description:
Came here for the Happy Hour but it wasn't the happiest hour... The happy hour menu is changed from what I saw online. I'm guessing they were down someone but it was so slow. We ordered a few other rolls after about 15 mins because we weren't sure how long it would take. After we ordered it took 35 mins to get our few sashimi items and a 4 piece Cali roll. There was only about 8 other people in the restaurant, but we didn't get our rolls for another 25 mins. But watched others get their rolls and checks in front of us. The waitress had to ask us if we ordered more when we were waiting around for our last pieces of sashimi. 
The some of the salmon sashimi pieces were frozen and I had to stop eating them for them to thaw so I can enjoy them and the perfect temperature. The other rolls we had were pretty good! We had the Chaotic and Dragon rolls and the shrimp tempura we very full. 
The food was good but I gave 2 stars because I will not be back. The wait time and frozen salmon was a huge turn off for me. Come with patience!
author: Megan M.

description:
This place is kind of a divvy sushi bar. The sushi itself is good quality, thank goodness or there may have been some issues! But it's definitely an inexpensive place with a younger crowd. 
It was a little rowdy inside and quite a few sake bombs were taken loudly by large tables.
Came with a group of four, we had some sashimi, several rolls of different variety and some Sapporo and sake.

They don't have mixed drinks just wine,
Beer and sake. Wine list is not impressive stick to
Beer and sake. 
The waitstaff definitely could be more attentive but overall it was a good time.
author: Jessica W.

description: A big fan of their marina sushi roll specialty,our picture is on the wall and a lot of good looking people enjoying the sake bomb shots!! All in all it's the bomb
author: Izah S.

description:
Came here to celebrate a friend's birthday, the atmosphere was very lively and fun! Lots of people in their 20's come to sake bomb. Happy hour is 5-7pm, the happy hour menu has a wide selection of basic rolls, appetizers, and drinks. They also have great combo boxes that come with the selection of 3 different dishes per box. 
Overall great place to come with a group of friends!
author: Annie C.

description:
Looking for a good place for a birthday party? This place can be it! For $20 all you can drink sake and beer, you sure will get your money worth and have a good time!

Food here is pretty cheap, I ordered the nigiri combo and my boyfriend got the combo box. Both individually under $25 so pretty cheap! Quality is ok, not too fresh and the katsu chicken was soggy, but for the price it's decent. I think its a great place for big gatherings and get your drink on!
author: Natalie L.

description: Absolutely amazing quality fish. The rice was just a touch warm and perfect little pearls of sweetness. I had the uni and hamachi nigiri, the diablo roll (I liked the chop of the fish, but I usually never order rolls so this was just a  decision); my girlfriend got the dragon roll, a salmon|avocado and we both split the mixed tempura (which was beautifully prepared, compliments to the chef for his knife work). As stated before, quality ingredients and definitely delicious. We'll be visiting again (but maybe only for take-out as they play Pop Country music).
author: Sargon O.

description: Thank you so much for hosting our group! We had the best time, the service was outstanding, the food great, and we felt so welcome. Best Sushi bar ever!!!
author: Kenneth L.

description: We made a reservation for a Friday evening to try out the all you can drink sake bombs. For $20 and for someone who does not love sake bombs, I was pleasantly surprised. Sake was tasty, beer was cold, and the service was stellar. We had about 25 people in our party but some of the other tables in the restaurant were battling us with sake bombs too! A great pregame environment and well worth the $20. Only complaint was it was about 80 degrees inside the restaurant...lots and lots of flushed cheeks even before the sake began. p.s. We didn't eat anything there so can't give any recommendation on food.
author: Kara N.

description:
The #1 spot in town for 16 year olds to show their patently bogus IDs and be served sake bombs by an owner who doesn't care. Must be a great profit driver. I guess the tourists don't mind so on we go. 

How do these people keep their license?
author: John M.

description:
SO infuriated by this place. 

I made reservations for 5 for my birthday. I called and they said they couldn't accommodate my group until 9:30 p.m. Okay, I accept. 

I show up at 9 p.m. and decipher from the small amount of English spoken that they lost my reservation because the lady who picked up the phone for me didn't write it down. I'm told we can sit at the bar and wait for the next table to open up.

1,2,3,6 tables open up and over and over they refuse to seat us at one of them. People with 9:45-10p.m reservations are prioritized over us, and we are told that only 1 table in the restaurant would be okay for us... ridiculous. 

Service was painfully slow and they lacked in every way- food came out at random times leaving some people waiting 1 hour to start eating, waiting for others to get their food. At least the bottomless sake bombs help take the edge off. 

Check comes, surprise surprise: they added a 25% surcharge for having a party of 6 or more--we were a party of 5! Fraudulent too. 

Shady, bad service, nonexistent customer service----I will NEVER be back and will warn everyone about this place.
author: Paola M.

description:
If you're looking for great casual sushi happy in town, then stop here. I've been a regular at Marina Sushi Bar for the past 5 years and it's a wonderful place to get your weekly sushi fix. Of the 50+ times I've eaten here, the fish is always consistent and the owners are always super friendly. It's mostly known to get a bit rowdy at night but, I'm a huge believer in their happy hour. 

The happy hour menu just expanded so, much to my surprise on Monday I was able to order more things than I used to. Nigiri is $1.50 a piece (which is a steal in SF), basic rolls (kappa/tekka maki) are $3, and beer/saki are %50 off. It goes from 5-7 on weekdays so you have plenty of time to make it in after work. I usually sit at the bar and hammer the maguro, spicey hotate, albacore, tobiko, etc. Like I mentioned before, the fish is great and they are generous with their portions. 

If you happen to find yourself on the north side of town and don't have happy hour plans, then come check this place out. It's dimly lit, generally pretty quiet and a great option on your way home from work. I'll surely be back next week for my "fix" and if you wanna join me...well, you're welcome!
author: Benjamin F.

description:
Been here 40 minutes, they say they open at 5, but 5:40 and we've seen none of the food we ordered. Drinks are coming out fine...

******
Written after dinner was completed.

This was one of the saddest sushi experiences I've ever, ever had. The sushi was 2.5 star worthy, the service was slow as all get out, and we were all but ignored despite sitting at the sushi bar and intending to pay a LOT for a butt-ton of food, which we didn't bother with after waiting forever for our first round of sushi.

The staff was still setting up the (entirely dark) restaurant 20 minutes after we arrived (when it opened, at 5) and were seated at the sushi bar.

The menu was meh.
The fish was meh.
The rice was meh.
The servings were TINY and poor ratio of rice to fish.
The service was meh-minus.

It's the marina, ffs. I was super bummed we chose this place, it was a huge disappointment. After we left and drove off, I saw a poke-bowl place just a couple blocks away, and was PISSED OFF ROYALLY that we hadn't just gone there for a fast-food takeout experience, that probably would have left me fuller and more satisfied. Wouldn't return to this establishment if you paid me, and that's sad, because sushi is by far my favorite food and should never ever leave a girl SAD.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Underrated. Great prices for fresh sushi and good service.

Let's start with the amazing drink specials. Happy hour is 5-10pm, so pretty much any time you'd be going to dinner, and gets you 50% off beer and sake. They also have an unlimited sake and beer special which I believe is $20.

Sushi is yummy. We got a few sashimi orders to share and they were very generous portions. My friends love the specialty maki rolls.
author: Sara M.

description: I am obsessed with this place!! Very fresh sushi and great service. This has been my go to sushi spot for about a year and it never disappoints!!
author: Jackie S.

description: Well priced, fresh and balanced. Avoid weekend evenings unless you are trying to get ratchet with fresh out of college bros.
author: Alex B.

description: You are going to come here for a birthday or some type of festivity. The food is okay but you are going for the atmosphere and unlimited Sake Bombs :) Would not go here on a date, Friday or Saturday night as you will not be able to talk with each other (Gets loud). Go with a group and put your party pants on!
author: Ian E.

description:
Started here for a GNO with the coworkers. Happy hour for food ends at 7pm and happy hour for drinks ends at 10pm. We were seated at about 6:50pm on a Saturday night, so we ordered as much happy hour nigiri as we could before 7. After weighing out the cost efficiency of AYCD and the happy hour drink menu (50% off beer and house/hot sake), we decided to go with the 50% off, as we did not think we would be spending 80 bucks on alcohol between 4 people. 

The food:

- standard for nigiri, however the rice was kind of hard..
- ordered the Lion King roll (I am a cream cheese fanatic) and it was overall meh and the amount of cream cheese in it was insulting, if there was even any there at all
- ordered the beef teriyaki dinner and it was super dry and overcooked
- overall taste for everything else we ordered was satisfactory

The atmosphere:

- standard sushi bar
- Small venue, but a good amount of tables and there's a sushi bar to sit at as well
- gets loud, as the AYCD and happy hour prices can attest to
- service was an issue, the servers forgot multiple times things that we ordered.. so had to remind them and wait even longer.. and that's if we could even flag down a server to begin with

At a glance: only good for drinks.
author: Genevieve M.

description: Honestly their service is amazing and I always have a good time when I go. Recommend for birthdays because the Sake Bombs are BOMBBBB
author: Lena M.

description: Casual, clean, friendly, inexpensive.  I like the vegetable only rolls - vegetable tempura maki is the best! Good enough to dine in or take out.  Only reason to give four stars is because it can be too loud on weekends.
author: Sara N.

description:
Marina Sushi is WAY FUN on a weekend night. This is the place to go with a big group of friends for unlimited sake bombing (2 hours for $20pp). Sushi is pretty delicious as well, but with the price of sushi and sake, it can get up there for a big group.

Make sure to ask if you can play your own music, they usually let you and it makes for a really fun experience!
author: Kerry G.

description:
Wasn't so impressed by this place. I was hoping that they would step up their game considering that they have competitors nearby (Zushi Puzzle, Atami & Yuzu). The one good thing is that they have happy hour drink specials on the weekends. All beer and sake are 50% off.

I ordered the combo meal with salmon sashimi that comes with salad, soup and rice. Unfortunately, the waiter forgot to bring out my soup. It seemed like a great deal for $15 for 12 pieces of salmon sashimi, especially for me since I love salmon sushi. However, the cuts were thin and the salad was drenched in thousand island. Boyfriend ordered the chirashi which had 9 pieces of sashimi placed on top of a small scoop of rice with vegetables and roe on the side. Presentation was lacking and it was the smallest chirashi I've ever seen. My friend had the nigiri combo and a roll. I'd say his dishes were better.

The service was okay. Our dishes came out at separate times. It seems as though the restaurant is run by a bunch of young guys. The décor was lacking and the music was loud. Large parties started to trickle in throughout the night, making the restaurant even louder.
author: Helen C.

description:
four words: upset stomachs for everyone 

came here for a bday dinner, we left happy about cheap happy hour sake and beers, woke up with upset stomachs, vomiting and diarrhea. 

not to mention, the food took awhile (it was busy), so i wonder if they rushed and unfortunately didn't properly serve food that was ready. unfortunate, but it is what it is.

otherwise, a chill place to have fun dinners for those in their early 20s who like to party.
author: Liz A.

description:
I just had one of their rolls and it tasted like terrible. So bad I couldn't even finish it. Almost like a metal taste, I'm guessing the imitation crab they use is super cheap?? 

This is also my second time coming and I don't remember being impressed the first time but at least the food was edible that time.
author: Anjelica H.

description: OMG! This is now my all time favorite sushi house! The one I used to go to (Sake Zone) closed down. So I've been on the search ever since but have missed the mark every time till now. Every dish was delicious and amazingly fresh. We where so excited we forgot to take photos, LOL! I am so coming back with more friends.
author: Crystal P.

description:
Really fun place to come with big groups. On a Thursday, my friends and I decided to organize a big group dinner for the following day. We thought it would be impossible to get a reservation anywhere for 13 people, but Marina Sushi helped us out! Once we arrived, we were seated right away and had multiple servers helping us out at all times. 

The House Special roll is amazing. Deep fried rolls usually make me feel sick, but this felt fresh with that deep fried, delicious taste! If you're looking for something non-deep fried, the Fairytale Yellowtail is really great and fresh.

The nice thing about Marina Sushi is that the environment encourages you to have fun. They offered to play music from the playlists on our phones. They also didn't mind at all that most tables in the restaurant were doing multiple rounds of sake bombs!

Overall, fun and solid sushi/sake bomb experience!
author: Emmy Q.

description: I get the impression this restaurant recently changed ownership. On a previous visit sushi quality was high and service good. On most recent visit the manager was wearing slippers and restaurant was understaffed. We experienced two order errors. Overheard table next to us with similar order mistake. Sushi quality is still high, but rolls were haphazard and not presented well. Restroom was not cleaned recently. Hopefully just a bad night for Marina Sushi Bar.
author: Joe S.

description: Great place for a group of friends who want to sake bomb and party! The wait staff is extremely attentive to groups that are sake bombing... Basically they keep the sake and beer flowing if you ask them to. The rolls are great and nicely priced too. Get the House special for sure!
author: Julia M.

description:
Came here on a Friday evening during happy hour. 

Asahi, Sapporo, Kirin, all 50% off; even the large bottles. Large bottles are 6.75ish and the regular bottles are 4.xx; so it's a good deal to go drinking. House sake is also 50% off, but I'm not a big sake drinker, passed this time. Might be a good place to sake bomb.

Next on the happy hour, is sushi. They have 3 hand rolls, and the rest are sashimi on rice. Each sashimi on rice comes with 2 pieces, and the hand rolls are well, hand rolls, OR 4 piece sushi. Each order is $2. A friend said the fish wasn't super fresh, but for $2 dollars, it's worth it. 

It was fairly empty on friday night at 6-7pm. Service picked up just a little bit as we left around 8pm. 

The music was kind of nice for me. Kick back with some emo music. They had some 98 degrees - I do, kelly clarkson - break away, lonestare - amazed, whitney houston - I will always love you, backstreet boys - drowning. 

Yes, I recognize it all. Some one else at our table doesn't really like this kinda music, but its nice for me once in a while. Lighter music. There's a parking garage across the street... after 6pm, its 1 dollar per hour parking! Good for if you can't find street parking.
author: Kaje Y.

description:
i and i no dis is da place mon.
EDIT: I HAVE been here, it was years ago, but if you know what's good for you don't mess with my review.
author: Tom B.

description:
Fresh sushi, careful with delivery. The delivery person always seems confused, and often doesn't bring money for cash back.

But good Marina sushi choice, and really friendly in restaurant service.
author: Therese M.

description:
Allow me to preface this by saying that I don't eat sushi. However, people who are very dear to me do, so I tend to hit up sushi places on occasion, like this one. 

Marina Sushi Bar has the most insane happy hour deal for sushi lovers that I find it downright shocking that there aren't lines out the door. Pretty good sushi too, according to my dear ones. 

While my dear ones load up on sushi, I usually go for chicken or pork, some gyoza, rice, salad, and miso soup (that my darling offspring particularly enjoys). 

The mochi ice cream dessert is always presented way more beautiful than I do at home.

All in all, nice place, kid-friendly, decent food, and insanely great happy hour prices.
author: Loli L.

description: This place is great for casual Japanese food.  It's low key, reasonably priced (one of those rare Marina places that isn't overpriced and has been around for a while) and the service is nice. The bento box combo and happy hour sake/beer deal is fantastic!  It's not fancy or anything, but a comfortable and quiet place to get warm Japanese food (they have donburi and standard bento box fare) and a few rolls!
author: Kari L.

description: I love this place as I've said before. My boyfriend and I come here regularly for takeout but last night they surprised me...we came here with my aunt uncle and two little cousins. One of my cousins got teriyaki chicken which ended up being spicy because it had black pepper in it. The owner came over to our table, saw she wasn't eating it, and then brought her plain chicken free of charge. She even let us take a Polaroid for the wall - which made my cousins' trip to San Francisco. Thank you for not only having amazing food but for also caring about your customers!
author: Erica C.

description: Place deserves better than 3.5 Stars. Excellent service and a great atmosphere. Great place to have your birthday.
author: Corey R.

description: Love their dinner combos! You cqn choose from teriaki, saba, tempura nad sashimi!
author: Lizzz K.

description: This place is fantastic. Best food, Great atmosphere, friendly staff. I can't say enough about it. The sexy Lizzy, kits and a couple others our favorites.
author: Jesse F.

description: Love this place!  Me and my friends have been going here for 5+ years now- same owners, same great/reasonably priced sushi & great happy hour deals!  Especially on the sake :)
author: Faith B.

description: I am not sure why all the bad reviews? This a go to place to stop by for dinner. Their rolls are delicious. Quick service and not always full on weekday. Heads up parking is horrible and its best to go after 7pm
author: Linda J.

description:
We are in town for a few nights, staying at a hotel across the street. After a busy evening of sightseeing, we wanted to get as far away from Fisherman's Wharf as possible for dinner. We were craving sushi, and saw this restaurant across the street from our hotel. On a whim, we went in and WOW! Was it delicious!

First off, it's Sunday night and they offer a 15% discount (quieter than a Fri or Sat night). We (family of 4) ordered the following: edamame, seaweed salad, chaotic roll, beef udon soup, and a sushi combo (salmon, tuna, etc.) It was all delicious. The udon soup was a huge portion and easily fed our kid (they shared), with some to spare. The chaotic roll was unbelievably fresh and delicious. The combo was a fantastic deal at $15---tons of tasty food. 

Definitely flee the tourist spots for this quaint neighborhood sushi restaurant. You will be glad you did!
author: Erin S.

description: I live a couple blocks from this place, and it's one of my go-to Sushi spots. It's really fun on the weekends, especially if you have a big group. I've also done take out and the sushi is always fresh. My favorite is the muni roll.
author: Jordan R.

description: This is hands down the best quality sushi in the city.  Whenever I go to another sushi restaurant I end up disappointed because the fish quality of MSB is superior.  Try the Ikura and their Sake/Salmon and you will see (taste;-)  The staff is so friendly and the place itself has its charm- nothing fancy- pop music and TV- and Polaroid pictures!- it is a family sort of place.  And the price point is excellent.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Marina Sushi Bar is LEGIT! First, the quality of their fish is amazing and it really doesn't get much better any where I have been in the city. Second, they have a Happy Hour from 5-7 with $1.99 for some types of nigiri and rolls, half off beer/sake/sodas, and what more do you need?! The service is a little below par, but who cares, I don't! Go eat at Marina Sushi Bar...you will get addicted, like me! I can't believe it took me 4 years of living in the city to try this place!

And, the potstickers are tasty!
author: Casey S.

description: I've been coming to Marina Sushi for years now, and it's one of my favorite sushi places in the city.  It's not the fancy posh kind of sushi spot that everyone runs to, but if quality of fish and customer service are important to you, you should definitely take an evening and go here.  Happy hour is great on sushi and drinks (5-7 every day).  Tom and Joyce (the owners) are there most days are are just fantastic people.  Salmon is ALWAYS good here among many other fish.  Try the MSB roll, I don't walk out of there without ordering at least 1.  Great casual Sushi joint!
author: Prabal D.

description:
Soooooo....
Phenomenal Sashimi. The sake is amazing. The super white Tuna is mouthwatering, and can we just say- they won't stop you when it comes to sake bombs. Came here a few months ago, and look forward to coming back, as we were the last ones to leave, PAST CLOSING ( they didn't force or push us out). Super friendly waitstaff. The sashimi was just melt in your mouth perfection. Look forward to our next encounter here!!!
author: Jen M.

description:
Our food was generally good, even artful.  My biggest issue with any sushi restaurant is when they say something has crab, but instead, it contains "krab" - you know, that mystery meat that someone somewhere determined was close enough to crab to let it pass.  

Passing yourself off as something you're not is so 1990's.  Come in to the new millennium because frankly in San Francisco, I fully expect the real deal.
author: Danni D.

description: Hit the spot after a long day.  Very refreshing and delicious sushi for the price you pay.  We online ordered our sushi through Eat 24 at five, scheduling it to be delivered at seven. No problems with delivery.
author: Mark B.

description:
Came here at about 9:45 on a Saturday night (because we got back from sight seeing so late and were starving) and the place was pumping!  Very loud crowd doing Sake bombs.  Mainly a young crowd. I don't know if it's like that all the time though.  It was kind of annoying at times, but hey, they were having fun.  
We sat at the bar. The sushi chef was fast, but not talkative or engaging AT ALL.  Oh well. The service was prompt, but lacked friendliness. 

That being said....... We could actually taste how fresh the fish was!  It practically dissolved in our mouths. We tried sushi puzzle the night before, and although it was quieter and played more authentic music, the fish at Marina Sushi Bar surpassed sushi puzzle. 

I will make it a point to come here again when vacationing in San Fran.  This place is THAT good!!
author: L R.

description: Always love for the happy hour where I come in for great sushi.  Then they recently upped the prices, and not so happy anymore for me, so won't be coming back.  Good sushi though, but poor service, language barrier is a major issue, and loud people abound.
author: Kbai F.

description: My seaweed salad was definitely still half frozen straight out the giant Costco bag. I watched them pull out the giant bag, BTW. Their sushi was aiiiight. Live. so. close. but. just. can't.
author: Lillian S.

description:
Just tried marina sushi for the first time for dinner. The service was a bit slow but I didn't mind and overall had a great experience. 

The best roll I had was the muni roll- yellowtail with shrimp tempura! The spicy tuna roll with seaweed was fantastic. The hamachi nigiri melted in my mouth and the fish was fresh and spot on! 

Definitely going back
author: Evan H.

description:
Marina Bar is a great example of why second best is sometimes good enough. Think Avis "We Try Harder."

Case in point. This place is always my second place if I forget to call Zushi for a resv and they can't take me. I've been many, many times and while it's not the best sushi in town or in the neighborhood, it's always been a pleasant and yummy experience (though skip their miso, it's very sweet). The sushi is fresh, they have a good selection of rolls, sashimi, nigiri and other traditional dishes and the service is lovely but at times slow. All good though. 

Last night there was a "rice issue" and one of my rolls arrived quite late while my dinner partner was chowing down. I kindly asked the manager what the hold up was while patiently waiting and she explained the problem and brought us each a glass of wonderful unfiltered sake. What a nice gesture. Arrigato...
author: Meredith R.

description: I love this place.  I live right around the corner, so besides the convenient location, I can always expect great sushi, friendly/fast staff, and fast service.  Extremely reasonable prices.  Also, perfect for a casual date night out, or for a little "me time" where you can sit at the sushi bar. Plus, they have great happy hour specials.  I've been to many sushi places in SF, and this place definitely ranks high. Thank you, Marina Sushi!
author: Katheryn M.

description:
After a long day of Sunday street parties. there is nothing like the 15% off sushi at MSB. 

The service is excellent, the rolls are refreshing (love the Muni roll with the mango) and the service is excellent. 

Plus they are very cool about accommodating groups and late nights (even staying open an hour past closing for us).

We will continue coming back (and since you didn't balk at our How Weird Costumes, we're hoping we also get welcomed with open arms post-bay to breakers!) 

they also deliver, which is awesome, and they don't make fun of you for being 3-4 blocks away.
author: Mike V.

description: My husband and I attended this sushi bar after our second day wedding photoshoot. We fell in love with it! Great prices,delicious food,awesome service! We Reccomend it to everyone!
author: Liya V.

description:
I absolutely love MSB. Joyce is the biggest sweetheart, and the sushi is great. Also, they allow me to rage like I'm in college again, and it's socially accepted here--big plus. Needless to say, if you're not drinking or with a large group, you're probably not going to have a great time.

Food: House Special roll (spicy tuna, shrimp tempura, cream cheese and deep fried) or the Kits roll (shrimp tempura, eel, all wrapped with avocado).

Drink: Sake. Beer if necessary. Pound your fists and mix that shiz together.
author: Tyler H.

description: Came here for ordering take out multiple times and the people that worked here surprisingly remembered my name. Ordered their seafood udon and their fresh salmon sashimi. I would say the food is good for the price. I would also say that their sushi is very fresh and is made when your order it. The wait is a bit long on weekends though. Will return later to try the rest of their menu.
author: Peter C.

description:
We walked in not knowing what to expect and what a gem!! Happy hour on food and drinks on a Saturday night!!

We started ordering sashimi as soon as we sat down to ensure we took advantage of the full happy hour.  The sushi was very basic but fresh and flavorful.  They had options such as spicy tuna sashimi, spice tuna rolls, hamachi.  At first the service was slow but picked up as we continued to order.

For drinks they had large saki's, Sappora, and Kirin at 50%.

We walked out satisfied, slightly tipsy and still with money in our wallets.
author: Sutton A.

description: Came here on a Sunday night while the place was relatively empty and yet we waited nearly an hour for our food. Very slow service & only average food.
author: Janki S.

description:
Love the sushi happy hour! Their unagi is to die for! I ordered the yellowtail fairy tail roll, it's moderately spicy, well priced, and you could taste how fresh the fish was! So good! And they keep their fish cooled at the perfect temperature, when you eat it it's so refreshing. 
We were here around 6pm and it was very quiet, very relaxed atmosphere. The wait staff was very friendly, but forgot my husband's soda until we were cashing out. 
I will definitely come here again.
author: Cassandra M.

description:
This place is my FAVORITE sushi place in San Francisco. Their 49er roll is so amazing. It's so fresh and it comes with Salmon, Avocados, crispy delicious shrimp tempura---but the holy grail is the thin artfully sliced lemon slices on top-this makes the fish taste almost sweet. I'm telling you, it's orgasmic. Order it, you won't regret it. We've been coming here for almost 2 years, and every single time, the service is excellent. They're very popular for parties as well so try to come during either Sunday or a weekday that's not Friday--you know how the Marina is. Just went here yesterday and I'm still dreaming about it today.

My only qualm---why can't you be in the Financial District where I work? :(
author: K C.

description: Convenient, quality sushi at a great price! Very nice and helpful staff members. Love the house roll!
author: Dana Z.

description:
This place " Marina Sushi Bar " is THEEEE BEST Japnese restaurant that I ever had , one of my favorite place to go for Fresh sashimi, sushi and sake place . the owners are so friendly and welcoming when it comes to servicing their customers.  
I love the volcano roll " spicy " !! especially pairing with Ice COLD SAKE. soo good that I always bring friends there for happy hour and dinner . Oh and also they use really fresh fatty salmon that I just LUV so much.  that the cheap kind that you get it at else where .  last time I also try their UNI ~~~ so delicious that I cannot resists ! 
anyways , if U want fresh sashimi and special rolls and good service , this is the place you need to try  ^______^
author: Heather Y.

description:
I'm going to try to be as unbiased about my review and give people a perspective on my experience and why I did not enjoy. 

Morale of story: It's one thing if you take a long time for your food to come or if they happened to forget to put in the order, but it's NOT OKAY to try and defend yourself to a customer, not apologize nor show any sympathy to the situation whatsoever.

I was with a group of 10 people. We got there at 6pm

Everyone ended up ordering their food, and ate except for us 4 who were still waiting for our food. We started getting a little impatient but then another 20 minutes went by and noticed a couple, sitting at the bar, got their food and they been seated probably 30 minutes after us.

When I approached the server about our food, he didn't say sorry but tried defending himself and the chef. Not okay. 

It's about 830 now. We still haven't received our food and all we want is for the bill to come so we can leave. At this point, we weren't even hungry anymore. All we wanted to do was go home. When I approached him again to see how much longer it would be, he said the chef hasn't started making it yet and it would be another 15-20 minutes. 

So a few of my friends had to step in and plead with them. Still no sorry, no bill, nothing. We finally got 1 roll to go and the server still had the audacity to try and charge me for it. I told him that I don't think it is fair for me to pay and how he has the audacity to try and charge me. 

Again, it's okay if you mess up or it takes a while, but apologize or take it off the bill. Something, ANYTHING.
author: Reese A.

description: Best happy hour sushi in SF!!! Such great deals AND fresh fish!! We used to go to Naked Fish  on Chestnut weekly but they really went down hill. This is our new spot! :)
author: Lindsay D.

description: This used to be a great place.  On our most recent visit, 5 of us walked in late on a Saturday night when there were zero customers dining.  We were told they were getting ready for a large late party and to be patient.  Fair enough, we waited a few minutes and we were seated. We all opted for the all you can drink special and we proceeded to order several rounds of beer and sake.  About 20 minutes after sitting down, we were told we could no longer sit at that table and were forced to move to the sushi bar, this was strange because the restaurant was not even half full at this point.  We were having fun, so we didnt think too much of it.  About 10 minutes after our food came, we were told by the staff to move again.  We protested, but staff was literally grabbing cups and plates and moving them for us - mid meal. Annoyed, we moved to our 3rd table.  The rest of the night was fine as we stayed until they were closing up.  When they brought the bill, it seemed outrageously high and when we investigated, we were charged the $20/person fee for all you can drink, and also charged for 20+ individual drinks amongst our group of 5.  Upon protest, the staff said the all you can drink ended at 10pm which was  never made clear to us at the beginning of the night, nor when they started charging for drinks at 10pm.  We refused to pay the extra charge for the drinks and two of the staff started screaming at us to pay now.  As the reader, your first guess may be that we were drunk and obnoxious which is not the case.  We were polite throughout the whole ordeal, including being moved twice for no reason and had our bill doubled for unjust alcohol charges.  I wouldnt recommend visiting this restaurant.
author: Tony S.

description: Stayed in San Francisco for 2 days an thought... definitely need sushi!! We found this place on yelp an seemed decent  not to busy. So we went in an were seated right away.  Well minutes later he took our drink order (unfortunately no hard alcohol ) so we ordered our drinks an then food. We ordered 4 rolls an the wait was ridiculously long. Then we ordered 2 more rolls an a water an another at least 30min wait. An never brought the water. Also brought us a soy sauce thing with no soy sauce. So at that time the 2 in my party that were served their sushi had to wait 15min for them to bring soy sauce. (An me an mt friend still hadnt got our sushi ours took about 10 more min) Not sure if the waiter was new or not but he seemed very confused an slow then distracted with other customers. We also inquired about all u can eat sushi an he said usually they do it but that night they were a little busy so they weren't doing it!! Soo we had to pay each roll an wait over 30min for them!! They had 1 or 2 open tables an whole bar was open its a very small place so they were let that busy. But I thought that was pretty crappy. The food was very good and fresh thankfully. Definitely will not be back.
author: Nikki V.

description: Service is very bad. Food comes out at very random times. Our appetizer came after two out of four of us were served. I ordered a tempura plater and got a tempura roll. I had to ask a for my beer after my food arrived. The table behind us got a bill before half of the food arrived at their table. The food was good when it got here. I would go anywhere else but here for sushi while in SF.
author: Stephen P.

description:
Dropped in here on a whim for some drinks while we were waiting or our table at Zushi Puzzle. Got seated right away and ordered just a beer and two hand rolls to pass the time, but it took forever for them to serve us. Two parties came in after us and both got their drinks and plate set up before us.

Then after 20 minutes, we finally got our handrolls, but one of them was wrong since they accidentally gave us someone else's order. 

Now you're probably thinking that I am being a little harsh, but I think it's justified as I used to work as a waitress in a sushi restaurant myself. Overall, food was ok, but the service was definitely lacking.
author: Joanna Q.

description:
My wife and I tried to go to Zushi Puzzle just up the block on a Thursday night, but it was packed and we wouldn't have been able to get a seat for at least 30 minutes.  I might be reading too much into the encounter, but the employee we talked to at Zushi Puzzle didn't make me feel like he actually wanted our patronage.  It felt as if, because we had the gall to walk in without a reservation on a Thursday night, we were a nuisance that he felt should not have been there.

In contrast, the Marina Sushi Bar was almost empty, so we strolled right in and were greeted by a waiter who showed us to our table.  The service was prompt and fairly attentive, and I really liked the atmosphere inside the restaurant.  The decor is nice and it feels very cozy and welcoming.  And because there were only a few other people there, we got to overhear some very interesting conversations at other tables.  They added some welcome entertainment to our meal.  (I try not to eavesdrop, but sometimes you just can't help it.)

My sushi was quite good.  It tasted very fresh and for the most part had a very nice soft consistency.  Each order of nigiri was served with a thing slice of lemon on the side.  I'm not sure how I feel about this... it added a slight lemony flavor to the first bite of each piece.  It wasn't bad, but it was unusual, and I'm undecided as to whether I liked it.  At any rate, I'm sure you could ask for no lemon slices if you don't want any.

The rest of my meal was good, too.  I really liked their salad dressing, and the miso soup was just right.  Other reviewers seemed to have found it a bit bland, but I thought it was perfect; I don't like it when my miso soup is so salty that one bowl puts me over the recommended daily limit for sodium intake.  (That's an exaggeration, obviously, but my point is that if you prefer your miso soup to be a little less salty, you'll like the miso here.)

I'm just visiting SF so I can't honestly say that I know how Marina compares to the many other sushi restaurants in the area.  However, I've eaten a lot of sushi in other cities, and I really enjoyed my meal at Marina.  It definitely gets a thumbs up from me.
author: Mitch L.

description: I love Marina Sushi...we come in at least once a week they are a great local joint! Salmon & tuna sashimi is yummmm
author: Brandie G.

description:
Absolute favorite sushi bar around! They have the best service and the best prices.. Happy hour is a steal and you will leave beyond full. This is my friends go to spot for a quick dinner or a group party. They're even kind enough to deliver just down the block (sometimes walking is just too much of a task)

Favorites: house special, royal king, 49er roll and of course the sake :)
author: Kat J.

description:
Outstanding place -- great sushi and even better staff! I don't know what other people posting reviews are talking about, but I stumbled on this gem a month and a half ago and have been coming back consistently since.

The owner, Joyce is such a sweetheart! She greets us warmly whenever we come in and knows our order instantly. The fish is so fresh and good. For other places, they usually give very small portions during happy hour, but not MSB!

Great price, great food and excellent waiters. If you're in the Marina, make sure to come by!
author: Mariel F.

description:
Phenomenal service and food. Strikes the perfect mark for 20/30 somethings who want to sit down and have a good time without going overboard. 

Quality sashimi, amazing happy hour specials, 2 TV's streaming top 40 music videos, good conversation with the sushi chef. A great place to take a date, even the little candies on your way out are delicious! 

A place to find serenity after a long day's work and refreshingly located just off-Chestnut. A true gem along Lombard that I've already started to frequent.
author: Nelson C.

description: Excellent service & food! I went there during happy hour and their sushi is only $1.99 per order. I was kind of worry about the quality of the fish at first since it was so cheap. However, I was very surprised with the sushi! The sushi taste great!
author: Ivy S.

description:
It seems like their main source of customers are the spillover from zushi puzzle and mas sake, the two more popular sushi bars on either side of the place.  The people who were going to Mas Sake might not notice a difference in quality (I mean, they were going to Mas Sake) but if Zushi Puzzle has too long a wait for then Marina Sushi Bar will be a large let down.

The miso soup was a bit watered down. The salmon sashimi appetizer came out really cold in quite small slices. It wasn't that bad, but it compared badly to the sashimi you can get from nijaya supermarket.

The marina sushi bar roll was actually quite good. It was baked salmon on top of a crab and avocado roll. I don't think they told us the salmon was cooked on the menu, but considering the quality of their sashimi it was a good choice.

At this point the gf was refilling her soy sauce and a fly came out of the tea cup. They were very apologetic, and they explained  "Oh, that happens because we leave the soy sauce holders next to these plants."  It's probably a sign that they should get fake plants. 

Another roll involved tuna, shrimp and crab. That's basically what it said on the menu, they failed to add that they doused in garlic sauce.  That's fine if I'm feeling like garlic, but garlic isn't something I'm interested in when I'm getting sushi. It is possible that there was something wrong with the tuna which caused them to do this because my gf couldn't even bring herself to finish the spicy tuna handroll she ordered. My spicy scallop handroll tasted okay, but it was made so the bottom was a little soggy which was weird.

I actually liked the other roll which had unagi and crab inside with some type of roe and a dash of hot sauce on top.

The service was quite decent, but without consistent quality food backing it up it is hard for that to add up to much. It would also be nice if the menu added more descriptions of what actually went into the rolls beyond the fish inside. If they want to give the customers the option of taking a flier on their chef's creativity they should add the option for omakase rolls.
author: Jeff L.

description:
Tried Marina Sushi last year and then again this year with a group of friends and then with Realtor Betty ... Owner Joyce and Owner/Sushi Chef Tom really have things worked out since I visited last year.  The fish and everything else is really fresh and they use premium ingredients.  Tom is quite adventurous with his rolls and his assistants are all quite adept with respective duties.  Sashimi is delightful, service is top notch.  Realtor Betty indicated that she was a bit disconcerted with the wait staff running around but I WANT MY SERVER PEOPLE TO RUN when I am waiting for food~ahaha~

Had a chance to chat with Joyce and watch her in action with a large party.  Marina Sushi is an excellent locale for larger parties.  They will even set up karoke for your group.  I noticed Joyce was rather liberal with giveaways to large parties ... in the spirit of making sure everyone has a good time and make Marina Sushi THEIR "go to" sushi place on Lombard, adjoining the Union Street bar scene.  

Parking isn't bad, on street or they have an accomodation with a neighbor motel to park for $5 while you dine.

Haven't tried their Happy Hour specials but they seem pretty phenomenal.  Given their predeliction for quality ingredients, you really can't go wrong with that.

Note that they have a "VIP Club" that entitles you to 30% off their already quite reasonable prices.  Just introduce your Yelper self to Joyce, you really can't miss her and she adds to the dining experience in entertaining, amusing fashion.  Tell her Terry said she would make you a "VIP."

Very friendly place.  You can make it your "Cheers" ("...where everybody knows your name...") and be sure that you will be made to feel special.

And if by chance something isn't to your liking, this is one place where they will ask you how to make it to your liking.  I've had Japanese food numerous times in Japan, HK, Shanghai, Honolulu, etc.  I know a few Japanese premium restaurant owners and I'm Japanese so ... I say drop by and give them a try!!!  I quite enjoyed and liked it.
author: Terry A.

description:
Hi-larious.  Walked in at 11:15 pm last night, and there was a birthday party in the back doing karaoke.  Doing karaoke really poorly.  Pop songs from the late '90s/early '00s.  Like, Willa Ford "I Wanna Be Bad."  

Yeah.  How long has it been since you heard THAT one?

Staff was jovial, and the waitress confided in us that was largely 'cause they'd had one too many.  Awesome.  Sushi chef was friendly and the fish was DELICIOUS.  Prices were totally reasonable, especially considering the general prices in the area.  

If I ever accidentally find myself in the Marina again, I'm sooooo there.
author: Caitlin M.

description:
What a find! We were looking for a restaurant in the area that had both sushi and tempura (I don't like raw fish but my husband does!) We saw the Yelp reviews of this place and decided to give it a try. What a pleasure! The staff was exceedingly friendly  and helpful, and the food was delicious and well priced. We came in during happy hour, which didn't hurt - they had a great deal on sushi $2 for 2 pieces. 

My husband had shrimp, tuna and salmon sushi and I had the tempura. For fun I also tried a asparagus bacon roll. All of the food was great.

Next time we are in town, we will definitely be back!
author: Janelle M.

description:
Super Good. We will definitly be back. Going for thier Happy Hours specials are a great deal. 

The House Roll was super good. We took all the Servers reccomendations and we are glad we did everything was awesome-Salmon, Blue Fin.
author: Jack S.

description:
I just ordered from Marina Sushi Bar from the first time. Being new to the neighborhood I wanted to explore some take out sushi. The menu is huge with a lot of items, but I'm a simple guy and just wanted a Chicken Teriyaki Dinner with a California Roll. I had to wait 45 minutes to pick up my order because they were "busy". When I arrived there were 2 tables full. The atmosphere is not the best for a date night. It's more for a cheap place to get sushi. The entire place smells pretty fishy. 

The Chicken was ok. The rice was rice. The salad dressing was alright. The California Roll was not that great. I'm not a big sushi guy and actually like the taste of imitation crab, but this crab was a bit different. It says "special crab" on the menu so who knows what it was. 

Would I go back...? Probably not. I did see a sign for $1.99 sushi...maybe if they have a sake bomb special I would try it.
author: Ryan E.

description: Really good sushi, they have real blue fin tuna!!
author: Dehong H.

description: The owner is amazing, friendly, and caring! The food is delicious and the beer as well. I highly recommend this place whether you're a tourist or a local :)
author: Grigorio R.

description: Delicious and very affordable. Try Spicy Fiesta Roll
author: M P.

description:
I went here with a friend about a week ago because Marina Sushi has always been good enough. 
I noticed the menus were different. We found out the ownership had changed about a month ago and they are making it their own. The owner was so friendly as was the waiter and sushi chef. I will say that more wait staff would be vital on a busy night but since it was when the Giants and Phillies played, the space was empty. 

I liked the food before but I have to say it's even better now. I loved it! So fresh, even the avocado tasted alive. The chef was even willing to try a veggie roll off the old menu to experiment (my friend is a vegetarian). I had this spicy tuna type roll that was fantastic. And we always get a sweet potato roll. This may have been one of my favorite. 

They couldn't have been kinder and I was so impressed with the food, and I'm picky. I have my favorite and rarely deviate. 

They also have this sour apple Saki they had us try that was awesome, and I don't like girlie drinks. 

Overall, new owners, better food, friendly staff. I can't wait to go back. If you haven't been in a long time, I suggest you go back to see what's new.
author: Suzanna G.

description:
On a cold and wet SF night, my friend and I found this place. The sushi was very, very good, but the service was outstanding! The hostess was very kind and warm and gave us free sake...awesome!

I would definitely go back.
author: Angie L.

description:
Came here with the family for dinner...
first time I had butterfish - yummy
first time I had my spicy tuna handroll wrapped in a soy wrapper (instead of nori) - it was different, cool because it was soy, but it tasted like paper with some sesame seeds on it.  
good agedashi tofu
yes, like everyone noted, very creative rolls
beef teriyaki was a bit overcooked
tempura is tempura
service was excellent
the only thing I think they need to change is their bathroom.  The whole restaurant has this cool, mellow, contemporary feel and look to it, but when you step into the bathroom, ouch.  it's like walking into an institutional bathroom: really bright lighting, one of the handles of the faucet was broken, just not good.  All it needs is a fresh coat of neutral color paint, a little shelf and maybe a candle or artwork... please?!
author: Debbie N.

description:
So I bought a discount from some deal site and went for a date night. The atmosphere was fun, lots of people in their 20s doing sake bombs, but that's about all this place had going for itself. I first ordered the rainbow roll. The first time they brought the roll out it wasn't as described on the menu, so I had to send it back. The second time they brought it out, it was correct, but the flavors and textures weren't there. Then I also ordered a mix of maguro/sake sashimi. It was decent.

My biggest problem, which brought this place down from a three star to a two star was that while sitting at the bar, I noticed the sushi maker cutting from frozen fish. That just doesn't do it for me and is a big turn off. The reason I gave this place a three star still was the service. The owner is really nice and brought us over a free bottle of sake to thank us for coming to the restaurant for the first time.

I'd go back with a big group of friends if I was looking for reasonably priced food and a party, but not for a date or amazing sushi.
author: Emily K.

description: Lots of delicious and healthy choices for a sushi lover who doesn't eat rice...sashimi was fresh and delicious, hamachi kama was well seasoned and cooked perfectly, salads were great.  The price was reasonable, vibe was friendly and comfortable, and the sole waiter taking care of a full restaurant single handed did a great job being as attentive as possible and making us feel welcomed. I would easily come back here.
author: Nilu r.

description:
We always eat here. Good sushi! What can I say? Its closer to my place.
And the owner, the chef and  waitresses are very nice. We definitely will come back again!
author: Arden G.

description:
The food gets 4 stars: sushi was fresh and the rolls were very creative.  I'm not big on rolls and wish they would've had chirashi on the menu.  Although the sashimi was very fresh and good, the portions were quite small.

Two stars for the service: the waitstaff was very friendly, but disorganized.  There where only 3 or 4 tables of people for half of the night, and at least one waiter per table.  Still, they managed to forget our orders.  We often had to ask for something two or three times.

Later on in the night a large group came in (reserved a table for 10 or 12) and ruined our night.  They were so loud and obnoxious it made our dining experience unbearable.  Granted it's not the restaurant's fault, and they were adding up a big tab, but the owner / waitstaff should have said something to be respectful to the other customers.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Surprisingly really good sushi.  Not the best ambiance, but the food is great and the servers and owners are very nice and care about their product.

The sushi is fresh (salmon is outstanding), and the Happy Hour is a GREAT deal.  Not really a date spot (bright lights, tables not very intimate), but good for groups or a casual hang out for a really good dinner.  We go weekly.  Definitely recommend.
author: Wesley G.

description: Worst service ever. One waiter to about 60 people. Unless it's dead do not go there. We walked out after waiting one hour for food.
author: Natalia M.

description: Tried this place out when stopping for a day in San Fran. The food was awesome and our server was very nice. We did come on Christmas Day and it was one of the very very few restaurants open, so naturally it was very busy and they we're understaffed. But they did make the best of their situation and the food was still great. I'll definitely be back, just on Christmas Day.
author: Estefania P.

description: Pretty solid sushi and a good location. We had the veggie tempura, hamachi sashimi, dragon roll, and a few other things with sake too. I'm super picky about sushi so I wasn't amazed, but it's a good spot and they are priced well.
author: Sheeva G.

description:
I feel pretty bad about this but what needs to be said, needs to be said. 
First, they need more waitstaff. Even for a small place, they needs more sushi chefs and more waitresses. 
Second, BECAUSE they have little waitstaff... There isn't enough time for them to take pride in their handmade or special rolls. Each roll literally fell apart, even before dipping into soy sauce. 
Thirdly, I understand that the need for more people can cause increase amounts of stress but come on!!! There's no need to be rude on over phone and I'm sorry, but if your yelp advertises delivery, then deliver. Don't misadvertise.
author: Jenn H.

description: Super delicious sushi.  Love the Walu and the Volcano Roll.  No complaints about service at all.  I'll definitely be back.
author: David P.

description:
yum!
1/2 price sake and beer 5 - 10pm on weekdays. sushi is solid, fresh, and good. 
not overpriced. not overcrowded. all in all a great place.
author: Danielle R.

description: Incredibly happy hour from 5-7. Delicious inexpensive sushi. Highly recommend if you want an inexpensive sushi place with great service.
author: Finn F.

description:
We had been here a few years ago and it was good but we also found a better place in the neighborhood. But there was a trubates deal going on so I figured why not try it again. Surprise apparently it had been so long that the ownership changed as did the menu. The menu is alot more appetizing in terms of the maki rolls were our favorite. 

We had the hamachi maki, tuna maki, rock and roll and dragon roll. Everything tasted great, but then we ordered the spider roll. Eeek. the rice was hot and kinda mushy, it's nice that the crab in the roll was freshly deepfried, but then the oils get mixed in with the rice and its not just a great flavor. Every other roll we tried was great tho!
author: Sara D.

description: If you want to order in Japanese like Eric S. (see below) then go somewhere else.  If you want some of the best quality sushi in north SF, then this is your spot.  Excellent every time.
author: Ari L.

description:
Yuck!  Garbage!

I can't believe I actually ate here!  I'm normally so much more discerning but we were desperate.

Save yourself the time, money and gut ache and RUNNNN!
author: Little M.

description: Excellent fish. Cold and fresh and yummy! They have wasabi infused fish eggs that ad the perfect bite to your roll
author: Colleen B.

description:
I came to Marina Sushi Bar on a Saturday night and was a little skeptical at first because the place was practically empty when we walked in. There was only one other party in the back. But the good thing about this was that the service was excellent. Our server was really attentive and sweet. She came to our table many times to make sure that everything was good. The place felt really cozy and they were playing really good music, top 40, hip hop, etc. Here is what we ordered:

*Salmon Sashimi
*Spider Roll
*Dragon Roll
*a roll with unagi in it, can't remember which one, I know they had a couple
*Hot sake

I was pleasantly surprised at how fresh the salmon was! It was not too fishy or chewy and it felt like it just melts in your mouth. The rolls were really good, but none of them were exceptional. My favorite one was the Dragon Roll. 

I will absolutely be stopping in again!
author: Jessica S.

description: This place is awesome.  Especially if you are going with a big group for a birthday.  Great food, reasonable prices, awesome staff/owners.  They have karaoke while you eat which can be super fun (if your group is dominating it) or annoying if another lame table is dominating it.  Overall a really fun great place in the city.  Highly recommend for birthdays and big parties.
author: Yelp E.

description: Marina Sushi is my go to place! The staff is friendly and really make you feel at home! The sushi is fresh and the atmosphere is fun. I often order takeout and it arrives in a timely manner unlike other takeout places! All around a great place!
author: Meredith A.

description:
Some of the best sushi in San Francisco and very reasonably priced.  We went to Zushi Puzzle and we couldn't get a table (and the people there didn't seem to care), so we checked Yelp for another highly rated sushi restaurant.  Lucky us- Marina Sushi was right down the street.  As soon as we entered, we were greeted immediately by who we believe is one of the owners.  They weren't very busy, but honestly, the woman was so sweet we didn't care...we wanted to give them a try.

We are so happy we did- seriously some of the best and freshest sushi in the city.  Not only was there sushi top quality, they actually showed us that they cared we were there...unlike Zushi Puzzle.  I am sure we will eventually end up trying Zushi Puzzle, but we are definitely making Marina Sushi our regular go-to.
author: Leslie P.

description:
I've been going to Marina Sushi for at least 6 years and it's my favorite in SF.  My girlfriend likes it so much she insists that we go every time she's in town.  

Sonny, Eric and the rest of the Marina Sushi crew do a great job of making you feel at home greeting you when you walk in whether it's your first visit or 500th.  The fish is always good and they have a bunch of really good house rolls and hand rolls that make this sushi restaurant stand out.  The Kit Roll (tempura, crab and rice with avocado on the outside) is one of their signature rolls is a must have.  The Cooper Roll is another great one with tempura that is name after my friend who introduced me to Marina Sushi.  For those that aren't into sushi they have a lot of other options like tempura and teriyaki.
author: Steve S.

description: Sushi was acceptable. We've had better and I'm sure there is better nearby. The 15% Sunday discount was nice but didn't make up for the fact that it took 2 hours to bring out our rolls (5 people). My wife and I waited 2 hours alone for the 3 rolls we ordered. We won't be back and caution if your short on time or like to sample all your rolls at once to check out some place else.
author: Eric J.

description: Very good sushi! I like the happy hour, is very cheap. Happy hour start at 5-7pm and it's only 1.99 for the nigir! I really recommend. My girlfriend and I came over to the place and their MSB, spicy fesita is so good! We will come back soon'
author: Woshao L.

description: So I'm leaving 4 stars for the happy hour special only. This is a Chinese run sushi place with pretty good quality. The rice isn't the best prepared, but the fish portions are large and it's decent-good quality,  fresh fish. The 5-7 PM everyday happy hour special is stellar -- $1.99 for two pieces of nigiri or a 4 piece roll but the normal prices are very high. On weekdays the happy hour is slow and you may be the only person in the restaurant.  On weekends it's slammed but the service is still pretty fast and good.
author: Jacqueline A.

description: Sushi is bomb. Staff is okay. I think my experiences were much better because the folks who work there are familiar with one of the people that I go to dinner with here. I think otherwise, I wouldn't get all that attention or excitement when I walk in. Their fish is delicious though. One of my favorites in SF, but I don't go here without my friend.
author: Reanne B.

description:
I came here tonight with my mom and it was dead. My mom didn't want to come in but I dragged her in since Zushi Puzzle and Nara's was packed. 

The ambiance is nice and clean, but the people who work here weren't very attentive after awhile. 

Food was alright. We got a salad, Lg sashimi, sake, roll, and chef special.. The sushi menu should be more creative. I think the food was overpriced for the service we received. 

I rather go to Nara's or ozumo's, then come back here again. 

I know this is harsh but, I was not happy with my service... We had to get the waitress' attention across the room several times, and that should never happen.
author: Kissy F.

description:
Personally, if I lived closer I'd always be eating sushi and eating here. The rolls are creative and delicious. My favorite, the Eric Special and Spicy Special.

Here's a tip, the staff is really friendly, so be nice to them and for sure you can always get in a free beer or try some new sushi creation. Most places is just about the "hype" and they forget about the food but not here. 

As a regular patron or just someone walking by wanting to enjoy some sushi, MSB is the place to go in the Marina area.
author: Carlos S.

description:
This Sushi bar is not only amazing quality, but at such a low price it's insane! I lived next door to the place for six months and I always assumed that the sushi wasn't that great just because it was never busy. Now I am a huge sushi critic and if the fish isn't fresh and good quality I refuse to go back. So I thought I would try the place just because there is a $1.99 sushi special from 5-7 every night, so why not give it a shot for some inexpensive sushi? I was surprised that the sushi was such good quality!!! Now don't get me wrong, they can't afford to have huge slices of sushi at that price, but still, it is such good quality that you are getting more than your money's worth. Also the service is great! The sushi chefs and waitresses are the best!!! Now I live close to sushi puzzle, an amazing restaurant, but I have to say the service is sub-par, and for the price it's not all that. Marina Sushi Bar(MSN) on the other hand is great 
sushi at a low price, and they have the best sake I have ever had!
author: Michael D.

description:
Not for anyone who has eaten at the likes of Nobu or Matsuhisa. It's not like I didn't know this going in, but my Dog. Sometimes a little hole in the wall sushi joint can surprise you.  NOT THIS TIME. 

If you like ricey, mayonaisey, deep fried sad excuses for Japanese food this place is for you.  The chef I tried to speak to was Cantonese...forget ordering anything in Japanese...
author: eric s.

description: Not great sushi. I don't think it is as fresh as other places and the flavors of some of the rolls just don't come together. May be it's because they offer too many different rolls that they can't seem to prefect them. Our waitress was followed around by her daughter, which was strange. Not sure I like the set up of the restaurant but it clean inside. I do like to be able to watch the chef prepare the rolls but it's impossible to see.
author: Jessica M.

description: Not bad. The sushi is not going to blow anyone away but you can definitely make an enjoyable night here. Order some sushi, grab some beers and sake and take a group. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, allowing us to drag extra tables together and ignoring our obnoxious sake bomb chants. You should be able to find what you are looking for on the menu as well (it's pretty big). Don't expect anything outside of a very standard sushi evening, but it can satisfy the cravings on those nights when it's just gotta be raw fish (and probably sake)
author: Taylor C.

description: If I wanted cheap sushi for HH I'll come here. The prices are hella worth it, but the quality of the fish is okay. Beers and sake are hella cheap too. I think I would just come here to pregame and then head out to some place better. I've gone here for HH on the weekdays and every time I'm here there's barely anyone else in the restaurant.....
author: Diane L.

description:
This place is amazing! We stubled upon it when Mas Sake was too full to seat us, and I will never go to Mas Sake again now that I've found this little GEM!

The food is amazing, the service is prompt, the prices are great, the staff is SO friendly (I've only been twice, but Joyce remembered our faces the next time we came in!) and they offer 90's kareoke... does it get any better? YES IT DOES- last time we went, they gave us a free bottle of Sake! 

I know this sounds too good to be true, but next time you're thinking about going to Mas Sake, stop, take 11 steps to the right and go to Marina Sushi Bar! I promise you wont be disappointed!
author: Erin H.

description: I love Marina Sushi!!! Joyce, the owner, is amazing and just became the owner two months ago. Her and her husband, Tom, own the show! The fish is fresh and delicious, and the drinks are constantly flowing. If you catch Joyce on a good night, she'll join in on a sake bomb or two!  Seriously, one of the best sushi restaurants in the Marina. I went here when the old owners were in charge and didn't love it nearly as much!  Go visit Joyce and Tom NOW!!!!
author: Shannon W.

description:
This is the worse sushi I have had in years.  Went here last Saturday with my boyfriend becasue the wait at Zushi Puzzle was too long.  We entered Marina Sushi and saw that most of the patrons were in their early 20's.  Top 40 music was playing loud but no where as loud as Mas Sake. It took a long time for us to choose anything becasue nothing caught our eye.  And we noticed that most of the sushi rolls read like this, "__, __, cucumber and avocado."  The rolls were all the same. We settled on  spicy tuna, muni, and the one with mango. Meh, nothing excited me and even though i was hungry I didn't want to eat my food.  What annoyed me the most was that the rice on the roll was warm.  I even saw steam come off the rolls when the sushi chef was preparing them.  The service was all over the place and they didn't seem very organized although they were freindly.  They asked us if we wanted a polaroid picture to put up on the wall, which we said yes to. Cute idea.

If you want good sushi, or even okay sushi, and are in the marina, I would not come here. Sorry.
author: danielle l.

description:
I've got to say, I'm totally mystified by this stretch of Lombard. It seems to be the hot spot for skeezy bachelor parties and under-aged girls who drink 10 kamikaze shots at Silver Cloud before getting on stage to sing "Slim Shady" and puking mid-song, then collapsing on the sidewalk outside.

It's also the stretch that breeds "uber-hip" sushi bars that play techno music during your meal and feel that lighting in restaurants is so passe.

After I spent a relaxing day in the sun, reading, laughing, and consuming liquid cheese (queso dip kids! You won't regret it) like it was going out of style, with few girlfriends, and we decided  that a late-night sushi dinner was the perfect way to rekindle our relaxation after spending 2 1/2 hours in bumper-to-bumper Marin traffic.

As we approached Zushi Puzzle with our stomachs grumbling like a thousand tiny earthquakes, we stopped dead in our tracks as we noticed the line out the door! But it's 10:30 pm! WHAAAA? Why is this place is still jumping? Do these sexy foreign men standing on the corner not know that this isn't Europe? We eat at 4:30 in America fella; I hate to break it to you.

Since I'd rather swallow a vat of lard then set foot in Mas Sake, we decided to try out Marina Sushi Bar.

We were immediately seated behind a rowdy table of douchetastic men and their pregnant girlfriends (which didn't stop them from ogling my friends and making lame attempts at pick-up lines) who were celebrating a birthday, or perhaps a promotion at Google.  
Our waitress looked about 18 years old, and it was either her first day on the job, or learning the menu items wasn't a criteria for securing the position (but looking good in hot pants was).

She was nice enough, but didn't know what inari was, forgot to bring us plates and seemed confused that we each wanted our own tray of wasabi and ginger. 

The sushi was actually really tasty, but I found that the dark lighting made the fish look a little less attractive.

"Is this tuna? It looks black. Do you think I should eat it? Maybe it's gone bad. Nah, that's just the blacklight making it look inedible."

The prices were what you'd expect from a wannabe-Manhattan sushi bar and the service was definitely shady. As the night progressed I predict our waitress, along with the other waitresses, snuck out the back alley connecting them with Mas Sake (this alley is fictional) to do some lines off some hooker's boot, because seriously, we sat and waited for a good 30 minutes before we even spotted someone other then the sushi chef who seemed to work there.

MSB is nothing spectacular and I will only be back if my friends decide to blindfold me and play mean tricks on me, or if Zushi Puzzle is too crowded (and even then, I think I'd chose the Taco Bell/KFC over this place).
author: Sammy S.

description:
My water glass tasted like a fruity cocktail.  And the patrons included too many members of my neighborhood.  

Also, the sushi wasn't very good/interesting/fresh.  

The only reason I give it two stars rather than one is because there was no wait (unlike zushi puzzle which has a puzzling reservation system).  Maybe there's a reason it has no wait.  

At least I didn't get sick.  That's another reason for two stars rather than one.

I just can't seem to get over that fruit-flavored water glass.
author: Tim W.

description:
5 stars alone for being gracious in the face of a truly embarassing experience.  Stopped in for a quick bite while my laundry was washing around the corner.  Enjoyed my dinner... went to pay... heart drops to the floor.  No Wallet.  All alone.  NEVER happens.  But it did that night.  Darling Sonny says, no problem!  You pay next time!  I said no way- I'll be back in 10 minutes.  I'm amazed I didn't kill a pedestrian with the speed I drove to my apartment and back to MSB.  Sonny laughed at me.

But down to brass tacks.  Maui Roll rocks my world.  My best friend talks about it every single time we get on the damn phone.  When you don't want to scene next door, pop over here.
author: Jenny S.

description: Place was decent. The sixteen street roll was super delicious. And the customer service was awesome. They're super nice. :)
author: Mary O.

description: Came here for Sushi happy hour and had a great meal for under $15 with tax tip and 2 beers. They have $1 nigiri special and cheap beers. Can't beat it and everything tasted great. No skimping on anything.
author: Joe M.

description:
Good, not great, sushi at Cow Hollow prices.

Blue jeans, striped shirt, dress shoes, cologne.. I know where I am.
author: Patrick A.

description:
went in on a night where not guest was in sight. just a wait staff, woman who looks like the owner of the restaurant (and she was) and a sushi chef. 

boyfriend and i were almost pressured into sitting at the sushi bar, as the woman usher us with smile. she explained to us that they took over the ownership of the restaurant about a month ago, and offered us some miso soup as their recipe has changed as well. 

the miso soup is, well, miso soup. the kind you get in an aluminum package in japan town. nothing to write home about. 

it was very clear, however, that the sushi chef was not very trained in rolls. maybe it was just a bad night, maybe he was just warming up (and i have such a hard time writing this review because they were such friendly - albeit tiny bit pushy - people). but the rolls were a bit of a disaster.

granted, the portions were great. the toppings were plenty, and i was very happy with it. however, the rolls were simply pressed-together rice pieces. fall apart as soon as they leave plate. 

salmon skin hand roll was decent, need a bit of seasoning though.
author: Fiona S.

description: Let me just tell you the rolls here are so savory and delicious it makes your mouth water. I tried the fire cracker roll!! Feels like fire in your mouth. However they pack cream cheese to diffuse the spice!! The service here was exceptional. They are so friendly and attentive. One lady spoke to me in Chinese. So cute!! Anyway it's too bad I'm moving away from the city!! But no doubt I will come back here again and again!!!
author: Stephanie Cindy C.

description:
"The service here is ok, but the food is really good, so it's worth the wait," said our waitress. (wth?)  I don't think so.  

It took almost two hours to get our food.  We were a large group, so although that is bad, I'll cut the ever so slightest slack.  But it takes 20 minutes to get a bottle of sake?  And our glasses of water went empty many minutes at a time.  We asked for the check so we could make it before the close of  guest list to the next place we were going, but the "waitress" insisted that she try to get the bday girl as drunk as she was first.  Maybe, if the waitress spent less time fraternizing at the bar, we could have been placated despite the long wait for food. Maybe.  It's sad when you're hella hungry and the food isn't that great or maybe it was just too late for saving at that point.

I don't like giving bad reviews, but I can't give this place any thing close to a good one.  Maybe one day I'll return and I'll have different service and I'll find out that this place isn't that bad.  But from a first time impression, I find it hard to see myself returning or recommending it to anybody even if they were standing right outside and hella craving for sushi.

Oh, Taco Bell is fast, cheap and nearby, if you get way too hella hungry waiting for your food to come.
author: Robert G.

description:
I came here with a group of friends because one was celebrating her birthday. She likes this place because of the huge amount of cooked rolls they have. This dropped the rating instantly for me because, with a few exceptions, sushi is meant to be raw. 

So, I had pretty low expectations, plus its in the marina, not my fave destination. However, this place made you feel like you were not in the marina at all. It was pretty low key and seemed to cater to a small, regular crowd. The sushi was decent, not horribly overpriced, and the service was good. 

I would not go out of my way to come here, but if in the neighborhood, craving sushi, I would stop back in.
author: Drue C.

description: Good place for large parties or birthdays. Definitely don't go here on a Friday or Saturday expecting a romantic ambience. This place is designed to be loud and serves decent food as well.
author: Morin O.

description: Make sure you get the MBS roll... one of the best ever. Good quality and well priced.
author: James F.

description: This place has really great, fresh sushi. Their specialty rolls are creative and fun and there's literally 100 to choose from. It was reasonably priced and the employees were very friendly. The only problem was we paid with a visa gift card and they said they charged us a different amount than what the card said. I'm sure it was just a mistake, but still kind of sucked.
author: Samantha S.

description:
This is one of those places that try really hard to be hip and cool, yet you can tell behind the techno music they play in the background and all the 'fusion' theme they put on, the food is just below average. 

The restaurant smells, the bathroom in the back stinks, their ceiling is really low it makes you feel trapped. And their sushi rolls are not fresh, when you pick up a piece with your chopsticks it starts to fall apart. Are you telling me that's good sushi?
author: Kelvin Y.

description:
Randomly tried MSB the other day when I was in the area for a meeting.  As a seaweed salad enthusiast, I started out with an order of it along with some miso soup.  The salad had the nice crunchy texture I love, but was too sweetly dressed for my taste.  Miso soup on the other hand seemed mellow.  It's possible that the intense sweetness of the seaweed salad just threw my taste buds out of kilter.  For sushi, I went exclusively with nigiri.  After reading the other reviews, I realize this probably wasn't the way to go.  The rolls seem to be the main attraction here, and there's quite a selection of both your standards (like rock 'n roll, 49er roll) and unique house rolls.     

So I ordered bigeye tuna, scallop, and and salmon nigiri.  None of them blew me away.  In fact, the tuna was downright disappointing.  It had a very tough texture, so much so that  biting the piece of fish in half was considerably harder than it should have been.  I'm perplexed that the sushi chef even recommended it.  Moving on to the scallop, it was fine though forgettable.  The best of the lot was the salmon.  It tasted fresh, had soft texture and sprinkle of lemon for flavor. 

As inconsistent as the fish was, the supporting elements were strong.  I really liked the firmness and slightly sweet flavor of the sushi rice, and the wasabi/ginger were bolder than your typical sushi bar offerings.

Overall, the price tag just wasn't worth it.  My solo meal, with tip, came out to $32 (I drank tap water).  If ever back, I'll opt for the creative looking rolls.

2.5 STARS
author: Leon R.

description:
If I could respell BAD differently it'd be: 'Marina Sushi Bar' and I'm not talking about BAD meaning Good.
