Stepping into this place, you get hoaxed into thinking you'll be getting your money's worth (both in food and in service) due to the dimmmed lighting and intimite cozy restaurant feel...but we snapped out of that quickly!

It's rumored that this place handles large parties well...hmm guess I shouldn't have given into my highschool ways and trusted the hype.  My order: 1 Seaweed Salad.  1 49er roll.  I kept my order simple in lieu of the big group we had, but that didn't help much.  By the time
I got my roll, I had already managed to order 3 regular tacos, 1 empanada, 1 beefy cheesy burrito, 1 crunch wrap, and 1 parfait for one side of the table at Taco Bell down the street (which, after this review, I will be finding and giving them 5 stars; they truly stuck to their 3 minute serving time! Pure awesomeness).  After finishing up a taco outside with a few friends, I felt it was time to go back in and give my roll a chance.  Unfortunately, I was "welcomed back" with a lifeless tasteless roll which I tried getting others to eat. ::sigh::  

Don't get me started on the service...

Within the 2 hour wait period, our waitress managed to make herself comfortable at one end of the table.  She started chopping it up with us, like she wasn't working.  At this point I caught on that she had a little more sake than a waitress should have...yes, that's right, she had more than none.  She honestly was not reading our dismayed and hungry faces right because she went into how customer service is typically ok...

As we were trying to leave, she even got a bottle of sake for the birthday girl and started pouring it out.  She kept asking where the birthday girl was.  A little annoyed, I sarcastically asked 'Is it your birthday too?'  Response: "Everyday's my birthday"  which leads me to believe I won't be coming here again.

Restaurant Tip: Have a non fruity option for plain water enthusiasts.  Thx!

FYI:  I'm typically passive if my service and food are not so great...but this went wayyyy past my comfort zone.  Cheers Marina!
author: Abby A.

description:
I came here with a party of 30+ people and surprisingly it was a wonderful experience.  We did a set price with the owners of the restaurant for a all you can eat/drink.  The food here is delicious, fish is fresh and how can you go wrong with some sake??? 

The restaurant has two flat screen TVs and they actually play good music that helps pull in a younger crowd.  We had a wonderful time and our server was very helpful.  Parking is hard but what do you expect when your in the city?  Motel right next to it will let you park there for a small fee. Great place. Definitely recommended :)
author: KT C.

description: Another "go-to" when I'm craving sushi. When my bf and I first moved to SF, we were told to go to Zushi Puzzle. We tried but the line was way too long for our starving bellies. So we stumbled upon Marina Sushi Bar just a few doors down... and we haven't looked back since. Tom, the head sushi chef speaks Mandarin so we love sitting at the bar and chatting it up with him. He trained for years in Japan and, IMHO, his skills are legit. We find ourselves going back every time we have friends/family in town. Tom and his crew treat us like family, so why wouldn't we go back? Not only does the sushi come out presented artfully, but the cuts are generous w/ just the right ratio of rice and they always hook us up there! They have a pretty extensive sake menu and Tom has had us try everything from mid-range to top-shelf. GIve it a try, and don't forget to have your Polaroid posted on the wall!
author: Jaja H.

description: Not a trendy establishment, more towards the Mom and Pop genre. Nigiri was very soft, I had the Maki, Sake, and Hamachi. Rolls were very nice as well. A solid neighborhood sushi joint, though I wouldn't put it in the destination category.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
DB #1: "Dude, I got so wasted Saturday night. . . . I had, like, 4 vodka red bulls at City Tavern. . . . . "

DB #2: "Sweet, me and JC were at Balboa, you should have come over. . . . tons of drunk honeys"

DB #1: "Yeah, I was a little F____ed up by then. I had 3 sake bombs at Ace Wasbi earlier. . . . . "

DB #2: "No worries, I was pretty F_____ed up by then too. . . gotta drink wine at Balboa to get in with the cougars. . . . F____in' Kristy showed up with her skank patrol and put me on lock down tho.  Total waste of my striped shirt, dude."

Ahhhhh, who can resist listening to the standard Marina convo at the other table??

Slick atmosphere, yummy sushi, service is a little ding-batty. We asked about the size of the hand rolls and she described them as a "sushi ice cream cone". . . .not exactly appetizing.
author: Heather A.

description:
This was a real tough decision between 2 or 3 stars here.  The fish is good, that's not the issue, but on a Saturday night they only had two servers.  You only have to pay minimum wage!  Get 4 or 5, who cares!

We walked in and asked for a table.  10 minutes later, god bless her soul, she asks us if we want take out.  No.  Table.  We were the only one's waiting...

When our table comes up, we get waved at with a menu from across the room like taxiing a plane on the tarmac.  It was another 5 minutes before I flagged one of them to order drinks...

I'm so easy to please.  I really only rate on food unless you blow it.  Seat me, beer me, sold.  It's too bad they don't try harder, they're two other sushi bars within 2 blocks...

Auf.
author: Dave K.

description:
So I'm usually not into the Marina scene, but I must say that MSB surprised me... I had a great time here last nite!

Went here randomly with a group of 7 and we managed to get a nice table in the back.

It's a smaller, easy going restaurant that turns out some delicious rolls.

Service was friendly/efficient, rolls were yummy(especially those fried ones... REALLY came in handy after all the beer and sake we were chugging down...)

AND they had house music playing (sounded like Naked Music or Thievery Corp...LOVED IT) which was the perfect pre-party for the Salted Party afterward.

Recommended and I'm looking forward to returning!
author: Nenette Y.

description:
Hesitant to try Marina Sushi Bar due to such a generic name, my fears were allayed when I saw that the infamous "People Love Us On Yelp" sticker.  What they lack in an unimaginative business name, they make up for in their creative rolls.  

The sushi chefs are chatty, so much so, that I think it was affecting their work, as they were falling behind on their orders; it took awhile for ours, and a customer became upset when she found herself waiting longer than stated for her takeout.  But I did find our server to go out of her way in making sure we were satisfied with our meals, including offering free dessert when my friend had an issue with one of his rolls.

The menu is always limited for me at a Japanese restaurant, but I'm happy if they have more than 2-3 types of veg rolls, which they do here, not to mention their salads and tempura.  The food, both veggie and sushi were average--not worthy of running back to soon.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
My friend raved about this place and would always order it for delivery when we'd be too lazy to walk to our local spot. It always rocked and I had no beef.

My husband and I have now been there twice and I'm in love. The butter fish almost brought tears to his eyes. It was beautiful. Just occur ed to me, but I think this might be the best sushi I've had in the Marina so far. My homies rave about Zushi Puzzle, but they had like an 1.5 hour wait when we were there the other day, so I have yet to try it.

Unrelated because it's not sushi, but I'm a cucumber salad fanatic, (yes, I'm easily pleased) and their version blew me away. Crab? Oh no you didn't?!?! Awesome.
author: Jackie B.

description:
I remember this place for one reason and one reason only....the other patrons.  There was this lady at the next table with very fake breasts.  And one the other side were these two couples discussing how they can't stand to go to hotels that DON'T assign personal butlers. 

The restaurant is alright.  You won't have a strong feeling towards or against the food.  The lighting is really dark, usually I like that, but this place made me feel a little closterphobic.
author: Marc M.

description: I got their deal on trubate and came here all the way from san jose on my way to CA Science Acad. It was late at night so I decided to use the coupon and do a take out. The requirement/limitation on the coupon didn't mention about take out so I'm sure it was alright. However when I got there, they did not accept it and said that it was their fault and they need to change it. I just feel disappointed that since it was their fault, they should accept it that time to make up for my disappointment and change the thing on the coupon later. A week later, I came again to use the coupon as dine in. I even bought one more deal on trubate since I had a few friends coming with me. Their stuffs are very friendly, their place is really romantic/beautiful, and the food are alright. I would rate their food as 4.5, stuff as 5, price as 4. Overall, ok.
author: Yuan Yi Z.

description: When dining at MSB, one must have the hamachi kama, grilled salmon head, and don't dare forget the oh so sliced right sashimi...you must include butterfish in the assortment!!!  I really appreciate the fact that the soy sauce is the owner's original recipe.  It is very pleasantly fragrant and not overly salty like store bought soy.  Also, the miso soup is made with real benito flakes...how authentic is that?!  The owner Joyce is always gracious, accommodating, and hospitable.  The wait staff is attentive and friendly as well.  Great place to eat and you will leave feeling satisfied!
author: Evelyn C.

description:
The atmosphere is a little lacking, especially the gahstly open space behind the bar. The sushi, however, I was pleasantly surprised by. I got the combination sashimi plate on which I they substituted the albacore for the butterfish at no additional cost which I appreciated. Unfortunatley, that ended up being a bad decision on my part. The butterfish, usually my favorite, was the one fish I was dissapointed by. It was chewy and flavorless. Overall the food was good but you could get a better selection of higher quality fish for a cheaper price just down the street at Zushi Puzzle. 

Oh also they didn't have coctails. Just beer and wine, total bummer.
author: Taylor E.

description: Delicious sushi. Great......marina crowd. Good quality fresh fish and some creative rolls. Quick and friendly service. Tvs with sports on. Loved it
author: J D.

description:
The Kick roll came recommended by our server -- avocado wrapped rolls with soft shell crab = crazy delicious. The staff was great, room was sparely appointed and sparsely populated (but we ate early after not getting into the Puzzle sushi joint down the way) 
Im still stuck on Sushi Taro in DC but this place reaffirmed its hard to have a bad meal in SF
author: Sean G.

description:
In an area where fresh fish is readily available, finding decent sushi isn't THAT tough. Luckily, the Marina Sushi Bar adds a slightly different ambiance that adds to the great food. I am definitely biased since I'm a lover of trance music, but which other sushi place plays DJ Tiesto!? Such a rarity...

The restaurant has dim lighting with a contemporary design. The sushi bar takes up a moderate portion of the restaurant and offers a nice place to watch your sushi get prepared by the excellent chefs.

The sushi itself was fresh each time I ate here. As usual, I'd recommend the spicy tuna and spider rolls for first timers. Like other reviews, I've noticed small issues with the service. It does seem like they are slightly understaffed so service won't be best in class. It's a price you'll pay for tasty sushi in a trendy environment.
author: Tuan H.

description:
After a couple of very strong drinks on Friday night after work, a small group of us went over to Ace Wasabi to meet another group.  There are not many things I hate more than Marina crowd on a Friday night.  (Pete Carrol and the USC Condoms come to mind.)  Since we did not want to wait for over an hour in Ace Wasabi smelling people who smelled and looked like French hookers (and that was just the dudes) we walked over to Marina Sushi Bar for a less striped shirt and olfactory offending meal.  

We got a table right away.  There is a tremendous selection of rolls here.  We had a tough time selecting, but we managed to get it down to five selections.  We ordered and proceeded to wait...and wait...and wait...and wait...and wait...and wait...  I think I saw Rome being built on the other side of Lombard while we waited.  

The food came out so sporadically we lost track of what we ordered.  The edamame and seaweed salad were good.  The seaweed salad came in a more generous portion than most other places.  Plus.  The Moriawase sashimi was very good and very fresh.  Plus.  The Raider Roll was excellent.  Plus.  The Kit's Roll was super excellent but fell apart too easily.  Still a plus.  The Super Dynamite really stood out for me.  Plus, plus.

However, it took over two hours for us to get out of there!!!  The service was miserable.  I noticed that all the servers would wander into the back empty handed, usually together, and come back out several minutes later still empty handed.  I kept asking what the hell was going on back there.  The worst of the bunch was a little tramp who was dressed in what amounted to a white napkin wrapped around her.  She really sucked.  She spent all her attention on a couple of guys at the bar and a large group of guys sitting at one table.  Here's a little hint missy, don't piss off all the other customers because your working a group of dudes hard for a large tip.  Those guys are not going to date you and whisk you away from your miserable existence.  They will maybe sleep with you once and throw you away.  

After waving at the "help" for about 15 minutes we finally got the one of them to get us our bill.  The little tramp then brought it back, and she over charged us by 20 bucks!!!  There was a couple sitting next to us who looked longingly at our table.  Not because of the food we had finished, but because we had managed to get our bill.  

The food was excellent but little miss thang and the rest of the staff was horrible.  Don't go here if there is a large group of dudes there.  You'll be instantly forgotten.  I really hope the owners read this because I will never go back here.  If they fire the hooker masquerading as a waitress, I'll come back because the sushi was excellent.
author: Chris I.

description: Marina Sushi Bar is under new ownership.  Friendly staff, excellent rolls... I didn't experience the issues with waitstaff that others did, but it was fairly empty when I went.  hopefully they can work out those kinks and I'd suggest that folks give it another shot.  it looks like they're expanding the menu as they learn.
author: Nedra D.

description:
Where is Sonny??????  Heard he left the big city for his home romping ground, Marin (and not at his old haunt, Yu Shang).  Well, your time is better spent trying to find him than trying to get Eric to rise up to the occassion - he sucks.

The fish was so so.  Simply put, the prices have gone up and the service and quality have gone way way way down!

Sad to say after many many years as a loyal MSB patron, I will not return.  

But, I will find Sonny and soooooo should you.
author: Kiki I.

description: I cannot say enough AMAZING things about Marina Sushi Bar. The entire staff, especially the owner, Joyce, is so friendly and attentive. The food is great (try the volcano roll) and the beer and sake are very reasonably priced. This is my VERY FAVORITE sushi restaurant in San Francisco. It is perfect for large groups who want to sake bomb (upon request Joyce also pulls out 90's karaoke around 10:30 p.m.) or a quick bite. Love this restaurant!!!!!!!!
author: Alexis L.

description:
Nice alternative to overplayed sushi options in the vicinity.

One comment, take the techno down a few BPS.
author: T O.

description:
This is a great place for a casual sushi dining experience. 

I've sat at the sushi bar a number of times here and definitely cannot complain about the service. The sushi is fresh, the people are nice, you can't beat it. Check this place out!

Update (2/24/2008): So I've been back to MSB on a number of occasions and have come to the conclusion that they rock! The sushi chefs not only make the best rolls, but they are also very personable and outgoing! The wait staff are also very attentive to your table's needs - even more, it seems like they all enjoy what they do - serving up the best sushi the city has to offer!
author: Jonathan D.

description:
Like many sushi establishments in the Marina area...it *might* be OK if you sit at the bar, closely eye the fish yourself, and manage to avoid the teenage wait staff that has zero experience with the food or beverages served by this establishment. Buy the chef a beer, chat him up, see what's fresh and good and you'll probably be served well.

Alas, I didn't follow my own advice.

I'll admit it.  I'm a sushi snob.  We live in an area with fresh fish, discerning customers, highly trained chefs, and unfortunately some 30 year old frat boys and sorority girls (Hey Marina district! How ya doin!?)

For those with taste, please support good sushi restaurants, not places like this.
author: John K.

description: Tasty food but super expensive for what I was expecting. The rare fish was pretty awesome though. The Eric's role was highly recommended but ended up being the heaviest and most insane role I've had. Bring a wheel chair to get yourself out of there after that one. Eric was a really cool dude behind the sushi bar. You'd have fun here. We were a group of 20 and were the only ones in there. Kind of nice. And we could hear ourselves talk, which isn't so common in Marina sushi spots.
author: Scott D.

description:
The best saki salmon, butterfish and big eye tuna sashimi I have tasted in the city. When they have New Zealand Kingfish, don't order it because they don't get much and I love it.
Eric's Special, Kit and 49er rolls are awesome too.
Linda can put a smile on anyone's face, and Eric will keep the great cuts coming.
Also, two flatscreens keep you up to the second on scores...absolutely love it.
author: Jason N.

description: This place kicks A**! Super friendly and accommodating people, tasty and ultra fresh fish, creative menu, fairly priced - what more can I say, try MSB, you wont be disappointed.  I have a young daughter and they are totally cool and gracious with family diners (you know who I mean... those of us on the early shift) - their kids are usually in the restaurant too, I don't know, I just dig the place - looks like if i ever make it out there again w/ the later adult shift it'd be a fun spot too, lots of fun polaroid pics of customers posted. MSB has become my staple sushi spot.
author: Debbie B.

description:
Sunnnaaaayyy!!!!

"911! get me a 49er roll and some buttahhhh!!!"  If you can decipher what Sunny is saying, you deserve the fresh sashimi (fresh salmon is amazing) and creative rolls.  About 10 times better than its neighbor Mas Sake.
author: Bill L.

description: Happened upon this place while on vacation in SF (we used to live here).  It was great!  SUCH nice people who worked there!  Great food!  The House Special Roll was SO GREAT!  I wish this restaurant was in my city!  Absolutely great!
author: Staci S.

description: Excellent sushi with a fun atmosphere! I stumbled onto this place after getting a pedicure next door at Sassi Beauty Salon. The owner Joyce is so friendly and inviting! I got the house special roll, and it was delicious! She recommended some other items not on the menu which was nice and even gave us free saki shots on the house! It was my first time here and I was definitely please and will be coming back.
author: Jules N.

description:
Went here on a Friday night and had the WORST service.  We waited almost an hour for our food and asked the waitress 5 times for a tea/water refill and it never came.  

They have great sushi, but be prepared to dine for more than 2 hours.
author: Sunday R.

description: Surprisingly really fresh and delicious sushi! Great service and their Happy Hour deals are fantastic! $2 for all Sashimi and 2 for 1 on drinks. The freshness an delicousness of the sushi was an unexpected surprise:-) Just hadn't had sushi this good for a long time:-)
author: Lola W.

description: I just got back from France where they don't understand the concept of creative sushi rolls, so one of my first stops was at Marina Sushi Bar.  Their rolls are excellent (although probably not the most traditional), my favorites being the Rocken' Roll and the Lombard Roll.  Also, a glass of unfiltered sake comes in a martini glass, which I think is a cool twist.  I recommend this place highly for those who like "Americanized" sushi, because the prices are lower than most places, the quality is good and the staff is friendly.
author: Natalie K.

description: I must say.. Marina sushi bar has some pretty goddamn good rolls!  i came here for a friend's birthday and we ordered almost every roll on the menu. YUMMY!!!!  i already forgot the names of the roll but i do remember that most of them made my taste buds leaving happy.  only if i wrote a review for this place RIGHT after... i would have some recommendations.
author: Anna W.

description:
This restaurant was so bad, it compelled me to join yelp to write a review!

I went with a group of my friends for a birthday dinner.  We knew since it was a big group that we were going to have to wait longer for our food.  However, waiting for over two hours is totally unacceptable!  One of my friends was so hungry, she had to go to across the street to Taco Bell just so she won't pass out.  

Then we got our food and were utterly disappointed.  The sushi was worse than buffet sushi that's been sitting out there.  Another of my friends asked our waitress for wasabi.  She told him to share with the person next to him.  She was so drunk.  I can't believe she is even able to stand.  She kept forgetting the sake we ordered.

After we finished, we were in a huge rush to go to the club because the guest list we were on was about to close.  (We got there at 730 thinking that it was enough time to make the 11pm cutoff at the club)  Our waitress would not let us leave and would not give us our check.  She kept trying to persuade us to have sake bombs so she can drink with us.  When that didn't work, she said we can't leave until she gets the birthday girl as drunk as her.  She opened up another sake bottle.  Then, rudely interrupted the birthday girl's boyfriend's speech because she thought it was boring and she felt she could make a better one.  WTF!!!!  

So, we left hungry, irritated, $40 poorer, and still had to pay the cover for the club we were going over.  Thank you Marina Sushi for a lousy night.
author: Genevieve N.

description: If I'm having a good time and enjoying my food, I don't notice the service unless it's really bad.  MSB was just that bad on a Friday night.  The sashimi slices were really fresh and generally portioned.  The rolls were also really tasty.  But waiting half an hour between your appetizer and your first roll is unacceptable, particularly when the beer is not flowing.  We were so thirsty -- just...want...liquid...it's bad when you aren't even done with the bulk of your dinner and you want to go home already.
author: Mitzi C.

description: Joyce is awesome.  The food is very good and fairly priced.  There is a karaoke machine in the back and everyone always seems to be having a great time at MSB.  The happy hour specials are also great.  Dinner/lunch at MSB is always a great experience.
author: Maria L.

description: This place is quietly the best sushi in the marina. Its a great place to take friends who are still a bit iffy about raw fish. Sunny and the guys take care of you. Most importantly, you dont have to deal with the cheesy yuppie clowns that hang out at "that" sushi bar right down the street. Super Dynamite roll...fantastic.
author: Ahmad R.

description: Great sushi is an under-statement. Higher priced than most but totally worth it. Too bad I live 2 states away or I'd be in there weekly. All was great though the head guy making the fantastic sushi seemed irritated at his entire staff though he was very courteous to our party. Great water too; infused with lemon makes you drink a lot!
author: Holly H.

description: The sashimi quality is good here.  Remember to get Eric drunk, He's a cheap date.
author: Delon N.

description:
MSB is the grand funk winkle! Their sushi is the best. They make you feel like family. If you feel like getting naz and have an itching to shred, this is a great spot to start. Look for the Kits Roll and the Eriks Special. 
Thanks for climbing up our stairs.
author: Mike H.

description:
i like this place, its great. here's why:

- never too crowded, can usually get a table pretty quick
- fish is really fresh. never had a roll or piece i didn't like
- the rolls actually fit in your mouth in one bite!! i don't look like an idiot trying to shove it in my mouth or cut it in half
- its not too pricey
- they gave us free beer. enough said
author: Jessica B.

description: I have been here twice now.  Food over atmosphere for sure.  Why go?  They have a hand roll wrapped in rice paper.  It's stuffed with avocado, fried tempura shrimp and spicy tuna.  Worth going back for but not much else.
author: Gabrielle G.

description: You know what? This place is quietly better than the much lauded Zushi Puzzle down the street.  Prices are reasonable and the sushi is fresh and delicious.  Although, the techno music may scare away some, I personally enjoy a side of beats with my sushi.  ...Get it?
author: Sean S.

description:
The problem with living in the Marina is that everyone dines at places they think are "trendy" instead of good.  So if you are going for a drunken, party scene like the one at Mas Sake - this is probably not your place.  But if you actually care about what you are eating - then make the trip!!

MSB is amazing - I have sampled some amazing sushi and MSB is right up there.  It by far out weighs any of the "so-called" competition in the Marina.  Ace Wasabis, Red Fish and Mas Sake can definitely learn from the head chef and owner Eric.  Eric is always in a great mood, remembers regular guests and keeps the sake flowing!  The weight staff is chill, always friendly and on point.  

And for the food - the fish is great quality and large cuts.  Some of my personal favorites....the spicy scallop is out of this world!!!! It is different from the run of the mill spicy scallop with excess mayo - but has an amazing flavor with just the right amount of spice!  Follow that up with a Cooper handroll, which includes crab salad, tempura shrimp, avocado, lettuce, spicy special sauce..all wrapped up in a soy wrapper....AWESOME!  After having several pieces of Nigri, plus these little treats - finish up with an Eric's special!!  This is something that is unique - and might not be a first pick on the menu....but pay attention long enough and you will see how many of these rolls Eric turns out....simple roll with tempura shrimp, crab salad, cilantro wrapped in a soy wrapper and then.....drum role please......deep fried!!!  Eric tops it off with his special sauce and it seriously blows your mind!!!!

Go to MSB - enjoy the Food....enjoy sake bombs....and then go to a spot that is "trendy" - dont waste it on your meal though!!
author: Katharine H.

description: Okay, so the atmosphere could use a little help - let's be honest, it kind of a joke.  But the place has got character!  The decor - or lack thereof - combined with the crazy techno beats drives just enough people away that you never have to wait for a table.  If you can get over - or even learn to appreciate - the setting, you will enjoy some of the best sushi in San Francisco.  The sashimi is always super-fresh, the wait staff is very friendly and they have a long list of very creative rolls.  If you go, try the Kit's Roll - its deeeee-lish!
author: Erica G.

description: would be 5 stars for quality, but have had some bad experiences here.  It's been a few years, but awhile back we would go here in big groups and they would obviously over-charge us, trying to take advantage of our earlier sake-bombs :)   Nowadays I go here with 4 or less and really enjoy the great quality and the smart roll choices
author: Angela T.

description: Love this place!!  I have been going here for years!!!  They always have Super fresh fish.  Eric the sushi chef sure knows how to make some good sushi.   Erics special and Kits roll are my favorite!!  If you are in the area you have to check this place out and skip the over priced and crowded Mas Sake.   You won't be disappointed.
author: Shelley B.

description: A very nice place to eat for a fair price. There are friendly servers and fast service. I've never had a bad experience eating here and don't forsee it in the future.
author: Bryan Y.

description: Another one on my sushi fav lists: super fresh fish, tasty and inventive rolls, never a wait, never crowded, always good service, decent prices. This is a great place with a date or with some friends. Very chill and soothing atmosphere, perfect if you are escaping the crazines at Mas Sake next door.
author: Miss Lili F.

description: Pretty good!  But not the best, and not particularly inexpensive at that.  Overall, pretty good value, though.  Some beefs with this fish:  our Tuna looked redder and more gorgeous than any maguro nigiri I've ever laid eyes on, then was tough and grainy in our mouths.  Also, I don't mind unexciting ambience if the food rocks, but it was only good, not great.  Blaring loud trance music is a mistake, especially since no one listens to trance anymore.
author: Jes H.

description:
To be honest, I was a bit skeptical upon first entering this restaurant for the sole reason that it wasn't crowded enough. After researching sushi restaurants in the area before leaving, then finding the places we had as Plan A and B were closed, Marina Sushi was our third choice for sushi on a Sunday night. Apparently, lots of sushi places are closed on Sundays!

To be honest, yet again, and a good thing for a restaurant review, too, I haven't had sushi since....oh I can't even remember. When was it? Last October? September? Back when I decided to go vegan... and then three months or so later, I missed cheese too much and went to just being vegetarian. Well, Sunday night I ate fish. Does that mean I'm a pescetarian now? No, I don't think so. Because sushi is a rare occasion for me because I'm not the kind of sushi lover to pick it up as a quick lunch from some questionable shop. No, I love to make eating sushi a grand experience, complete with the tea, the sake, tempura veggies, edamame, pot stickers, rolls upon rolls that foreshadow what my belly will look like, and nigiri, oh bring it on! So yes, I like my sushi to be an event. I like it to waltz into the room and dance on my table, do a pirouette into my wasabi soy sauce and dive into my mouth in one great mouthful. 

This night was a little bit more laid back. No outlandish dancing slices of fish, but rather dipping of toes into a black pond of saltiness and re-experiencing the delicacy that  good sushi can be. I was slightly nervous at the quality of the fish when I first entered the restaurant. There wasn't even a chef behind the bar. Curious. There were two other tables occupied. Quiet and somber. Foreboding, even. And yet, the tuna and salmon practically melted in my mouth. The California roll was...it was the first time I noticed the cucumber crunching in my teeth! 

The highlights of my night involved the buttery white tuna, the interesting flavor of the fried banana and sweet potato roll, miso soup at the end, and basically the entire enlightening re-encounter with raw fish. Not to mention a really fantastic dinner partner. Would try this again, but I'm always hesitant to say that since there are so many other places to try!
author: Kimberly C.

description: It's a good alternative to Mas Sake. A hop, skip, jump away without the wait, congestion, and drunks.
author: Deanna T.

description: MSB is great if you are looking for fresh delicious sushi. Most places in SoCal, the sushi bars are always full with a waiting list... but I noticed in the Bay area, it's usually the opposite.  Well, better for me, because I think the only way to eat sushi is at the bar... so you can see the fish that they prepare & serve right in front of you.  Zushi Puzzle is great too, but the bar is tiny.
author: Myra M.

description:
Not a solid 2, more like a 2.5
I thought the Sonny's delight was a really great roll (shrimp tempura roll with lots of fresh crab on top) - the other rolls we got, I was not too impressed with.  I felt like there was a lot of teriyaki sauce or something on the roll which masked the taste of the fish.  We got the maui roll (mango and tuna) and I decided just to eat the tuna out of the roll and it wasn't that fresh.  We also got the soft shell crab roll - and I thought the soft shell crab was pretty good but the roll itself also had teriyaki sauce in it too.  Truth be told, the night started off poorly with our endamame order - it was way overcooked - and not warm, it was like it had been sitting out for an hour or so.
The service was a little dismal - it was like we were constantly looking for our waitress and never managed to track her down when we needed her.
The things I really liked about this place was it is a nice atmosphere - not crazy loud like Ace Wasabi's -- and the prices are really good, this place is not pretentious and it feels like a neighborhood mom and pop kind of establishment which is also a nice change from the other restaurants in the marina.
author: Katie P.

description: I was pleasantly surprised that I've lived in SF for this long and haven't found my way into Marina Sushi. The one thing that does set them apart from other sushi spots is the rolls for sure!! They're extremely creative with the rolls and every bite is an explosion of flavor. I actually like how understated it is inside -who says sushi spots have to be trendy and chic people. You are there for the sushi right? If you want that ...bring in your own decor and hook this spot up! Other than that please try the delicious Dragon, Sunrise or Erik's special rolls~
author: flo t.

description: Sushi was ok here, nothing special really and the price is like most other sushi places.  we only ended up coming here b/c all other places were full and msb was the only sushi place that could accomodate a large party at such short notice.  i think this place will end up being the sushi place that we go to b/c we can't get into other places.  on the plus side, the waitress was very patient with our large party when we were figuring out how to pay the bill at the end.
author: Jenny Q.

description: I really wish there was a 4.5 star review since this place is great, not the very best sushi in the world but def. in the top ten in the city.  The rolls are very fresh, the staff is always friendly and if you don't like the environment of mas sake like me, this is a great place to go.  On a date or out with a group of friends this place will not disappoint you.
author: Eli Z.

description:
You get home from work on a cold and rainy day and you know you want ...food. You don't have the energy to cook and you decide you don't want to leave your warm and happy home just to find a little grub. Just pick up the phone and call MSB (...or Yukol for a little thai action). 

They deliver. It might take 45 minutes... but they do deliver. That's a satisfying discovery.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: What can I say, I love MSB.  One of my favs.  There is better quality sushi in town (esp. Zushi Puzzle), but Sonny and co. do a great job and you will not be disappointed.  If possible, I would recommend sitting at the bar to ensure faster service.  Good prices given the area.   This is a good date spot too--quiet but sufficiently classy atmosphere.  The Maui roll is to die for.  I usually hate overdone American-style rolls, but it's damn good.
author: Jordan B.

description: For the price you pay, I can TOTALLY get better tasting and better sized sushi roll portions.  Although the fish seemed pretty fresh, the rolls tasted pretty bland.  More so, the rolls were kinda meager in filling...meaning, the seafood pieces and such- even the rice!  were so sparse and tiny. Hamachi, Calamari, yellowtail, etc....  i think it's overpriced because it's in yuppyville.
author: mark s.

description: I'm a first timer. Great comfortable small clean sushi rest. Very friendly workers n love the ambiance. I would suggest the unagi salad and their ankimo. I also had a chicken katsu and a couple of rolls which was pretty good. Oooo....and I loved their organic cheesecake. The sweetness of it was perfect and it was very creamy and crusty!
author: mark h.

description: I'm with Steve S. on this one. As much as I pretty much despise the Marina, I would travel far and wide to get to Marina Sushi. I mean, deep fried rolls?!? Come on!! Kit's roll is fabulous, too. I've probably been going here for about 5 years and I have yet to be disappointed. Everyone I've introduced to this little gem is still a loyal customer. My mouth is watering just thinking about it...
author: Michelle B.

description: I absolutely LOVE this place! I love all kinds of food so I enjoy many different types of restaurants BUT when anyone mentions Marina Sushi...I'M THERE!!! The 2 rolls that are ordered NO MATTER WHAT are the Kits Roll and Eric/Mark Special. The BEST! I've tried a lot of the rolls and they're all so good. The service is fast and friendly. The environment is wonderful as well, just a really nice place to have a delicious meal at! TRUST!
author: Carolyn N.

description: Eric's roll was great! I went super early and was the only one in here and i agree that things are a little slow here. Still I was satisfied. It was a little pricey, so when I go with 10 people we might stick to Kitaro
author: Dee L.

description: This is sushi at it's best!  It's fresh, and prepared with skill.  The atmosphere is elegant yet trendy!  The staff offers personal and elegant service as well.  The Spicy Tuna roll is to die for.  For those who are new to sushi try the Eric's' Special roll, Yummy!  I would recommend this restaurant to friends, family and strangers!  This is a must have!  The water offers a light yet refreshing tropical taste which is very enjoyable.  I would recommend for large parties call in advance they will set up the table and have your sake and beer ready for the sake bombs while you wait for the best sushi!
author: ZM S.

description: The Best sushi in SF hands down. don't be thrown off by the atmosphere, it is simple, but the sushi is fantastic! i love the kits role wrapped in avocado, can't go wrong!
author: morgan t.

description: Don't waste your time, that is unless you plan on having a 4 hour sushi dinner.. I went to Marina Sushi Bar last night and was officially traumatized. We were skeptical when we walked in because the restaurant was almost empty, we initially wanted to eat at Mas Sake but it was packed so we settled on MSB. It took about 20 minutes for each individual roll to come out, most of which were different then what was specified on the menu. Spicy rolls were not spicy, cooked scallop rolls were raw.. it was gross.  As the rolls slowly came out we asked what each one was and several times the waitress has no clue what she was serving. One of the rolls being the MSB roll which apparently is the their own signature roll. On top of the food being less then amazing the service was also terrible.. I would never go to Marina Sushi again.
author: Britt N.

description: we love this place! my fiance and i moved to the area a year ago and have been regulars at this spot since day one. the service is always beyond friendly - whether you're eating in or snagging delivery. the msb roll is insane - they torch the top of the roll and it's amazing. a great spot for sushi...
author: daphne n.

description: i have been here twice and enjoyed it  both times. i usually let eric the head chef choose and make my rolls. but the eric delight is really good. sake bombs are good here too. mike rowe, host of discovery channels dirty jobs was here when i first went and eric says he comes in like every week. a nice, small, intimate, dim lit place that isnt too loud like other marina places where you have to yell out your conversation. I'd come definitely back again.
author: Linda L.

description: Definitely a big fan of this place.  The fish is fresh, and the rolls are creative.  Sitting at the bar on the weekend is a good time as the sushi chefs there are a lot of fun.  They also make good suggestions as far as new fresh fish to try.  I live in the area and this is normally the place I go to because even if they are packed they generally get people seated quickly.  Definitely one of the best sushi spots in the city.
author: Dan V.

description: This is by far the BEST sushi in the Marina, Cow Hollow, Pacific Heights, Russian Hill, etc.  The service is great and Eric, the sushi chef is super talented.  Try the butter fish roll or sonny's delight.  You won't be disappointed.  It is also a great spot for a big party.
author: Chenin K.

description: yuck.  this place makes Nama sushi seem like heaven.
author: Kelsey C.

description: This place was horrible.  The atmosphere was poor, very cold, and they played bad music loud.  When we asked if they could turn up the heat, the waitress said they didn't have heat.  The sushi was very poor.  The rice was dry and the rolls fell apart.  This was the worst sushi I have ever had and the first time I was so displeased I felt the need to write a review.
author: Diana H.

description: decent sushi. bland atmoshphere and it was dead when we ate there, but I could see how it would be alot of fun if you got a bunch of people in there.
author: michelle k.

description: this place could have a really good thing going in tis area of they ramped up the atmosphere and the service.  the rolls are fun and fresh and it isn't hard to get into.  wouldn't go out of my way but a decent sushi stop.
author: e w.
